responses: Hi user, how can I help?

patterns: I want a new fire alarm
what kind of fire alarms do you have in at the moment?
What kind of fire alarm products do Ei offer?
responses: We have many different types of Fire alarm her at E. I. Depending on the room you want to protect we have four different Alarm types. Please ask me about them. The types are Optical, Multi-Sensor, Ionisation and Heat Alarms.

patterns: Tell me about the optical alarm
What does an optical alarm detect?
responses: Optical alarms are best for detecting slow, smouldering fires.Optical Smoke Alarms should be used in living rooms, circulation areas and escape routes as well as in bedrooms. An optical alarm we recommend is our model 3016.

patterns: What is a Multi Sensor Alarm?
Tell me about the multi sensor alarms
What does a multi sesnor alarm detect?
responses: Best protection due to optimum fire response – using heat and optical sensors. Multi-Sensor Alarms should be used in living rooms, circulation areas and escape routes. Our most popular multi sensor alarm is the 3024.

patterns: Tell me about your ionisation alarms
What does an ionisation alarm detect?
responses: Fast reaction to fast flaming fires. This alarm is most suitable for bedrooms. Our 141RC is our most popular ionisation alarm.

patterns: Tell me about your heat alarms
What does a heat alarm alarm detect?
responses: Reacts to heat and is resistant to kitchen fumes such as burnt toast. Heat Alarms should be used in kitchen areas as other sensor types are more likely to go into alarm. Our 3014 unit is our newest heat alarm. Alternatively we have a 3028 unit which detects both heat an c. o.

The gateway is a management tool for fire and co alarm installations. It is smart link compatiable and can send email or sms notificstions to you, the user. It comes equipped with an easy use dashboard and tracks alarm performance. This product is made to make your life generally easier.

patterns: What is the purpose of audio link?
responses: Our Award winning AudioLINK technology makes it easy to get real-time data from alarms – saving time, money and lives. All you need is an AudioLINK enabled alarm, a smartphone or tablet and the free AudioLINK App.

patterns: What is the purpose of smart link?
responses: Our Award winning AudioLINK technology makes it easy to get real-time data from alarms – saving time, money and lives. All you need is an AudioLINK enabled alarm, a smartphone or tablet and the free AudioLINK App. With help from our gateway, smart Link enables notification of alarm events via a cloud based portal system, allowing notifications via email or text as well as full visibility of your connected SmartLINK systems

patterns: What is the purpose of radio link?
responses: RadioLINK wireless interconnection technology uses radio frequency (RF) signals to wirelessly link alarms together with added functionality.  Interconnecting alarms is vital so that occupants can hear the alarm throughout the property. RadioLINK+ has the added benefit of whole system data extraction and monitoring.

patterns: Tell me about the delivery times
responses: Delivery on our products depend on where you buy them from. We are constantly making units in our factory to try keep stocks in stores high.

patterns: Tell me about E. I. Electronics
responses: Employing over 1000 people worldwide, we are headquartered in Shannon, Ireland, where all key Manufacturing and Commercial functions are centred. Our business has expanded significantly over our 30 year history and today we rank as one of Ireland’s leading indigenous electronics manufacturing and exporting companies.

patterns: Tell me about the companies carbon footprint
Tell me about E. I. Electronics zero carbon project
responses: Employing over 1000 people worldwide, we are headquartered in Shannon, Ireland, where all key Manufacturing and Commercial functions are centred. Our business has expanded significantly over our 30 year history and today we rank as one of Ireland’s leading indigenous electronics manufacturing and exporting companies.
